**Sensata Technologies** (NYSE: ST) is one of the world's leading suppliers of sensing, electrical protection, control and power management solutions. We design and manufacture devices that help satisfy the world’s growing need for safety, energy efficiency and a clean environment in global automotive, appliance, aircraft, industrial, military, heavy vehicle, heating, air-conditioning and ventilation, data, telecommunications, recreational vehicle and marine markets.

We are a rapidly growing $2.4 billion business with operations and business
centers in 16 countries and over 17,000 employees worldwide, including 900
people in mostly engineering, business development and corporate support roles
at our U.S. headquarters in Attleboro, MA.

We pride ourselves on being a leading global company with strong, local
decision making and innovative, complex products that make a real difference.
We have a reputation for unwavering integrity and offer global exposure to
world-class talent and significant personal growth and development
opportunities.

We are currently looking for a **LabView Software Specialist** to join our
team. He will take apart into Equipment maintenance and Equipment development
for the needs of the Test Lab. His responsibilities will be support the Test
Engineers if special Data Logging equipment is needed and develop control of
the future automated test equipment.

**Primary responsibilities include:**

  * Writing different software in LabView;
  * Support the Test Engineers in solving Automation/ Logging issues;
  * Support the team in development new Test Equipment;
  * Constantly improve present software and develop new software.

**Job Requirements:**

  * Master degree in Electronics/ Automation/ Electrical engineering;
  * Strong Electronics/Software background;
  * Experience in working with National Instruments Hardware and Software;
  * Experience in Equipment Automation;

To apply for this job, please send us your CV in English. Please note that
your resume is the key means we have for evaluating your skills, knowledge,
and abilities as they relate to this position. Therefore we encourage you to
be clear and specific when describing your experience and qualification.

title: PROJECT MANAGER / SCRUM MASTER
description:
|  **DESCRIPTION  
**  
We are an international software company focused on mobile security, privacy
and end-to-end encryption. Our flagship products are the Android-based Secure
Phone and Secure Pack, as well as Secure BlackBerry.  
  
**Secure Group**, formerly DELATEK, is an international provider of solutions for secure mobile communications. As the name implies, we enable our customers to exchange sensitive information safely, protecting their business and personal life.  
  
We have built a name for our secure and user-friendly Secure Phone and Secure
BlackBerry smartphones, as well as Secure Pack — our suite of mobile
communication apps. Our products employ the best end-to-end encryption
technologies available.  
  
**OUR MISSION**  
  
Our ultimate mission is to ensure our customers’ cybersecurity and enable them
to communicate in full privacy without compromising neither protection, nor
user-friendliness.  
  
**OUR VISION**  
  
No great goal could ever be achieved without a great vision. To accomplish our
mission, we have committed to providing the best encrypted communication
products, services and solutions, and to educating people.  
  
**We're now hiring a Project Manager at our main R&D center, located in Sofia, Bulgaria.**  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

  * Work closely with software engineers, QA, Product Managers and Usability to get high-quality product and features through the software project lifecycle (build, test and release on time).

  * Ensure your projects consistently meet standards and policies (agile, security, usability, etc.)

  * Take responsibility for release schedules and milestones, identify possible issues & risks and clearly communicate them to project stakeholders.

  * Work closely with product management on elicitating product and business requirements

  * Responsible for delivering new features and maintenance of released versions

  * Periodic performance review of engineers

**REQUIREMENTS**

  * BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
  * 3+ years of experience in software focused project management or technical lead
  * Experience with agile development methodologies (e.g. SCRUM, Kanban etc.)
  * Experience working with engineering and product management

_**It would be a huge plus** if you have:_

  * 5+ years of experience in software-focused project management
  * Scrum or Agile certification
  * Knowledge in software product management lifecycle
  * High-level understanding of technical architectures to determine project impacts
  * Experience with mobile apps
  * Excellent judgment, decision making skills, and the ability to work under pressure

**BENEFITS**

  * Competitive** remuneration**
  * Excellent** working environment**
  * Spacious office space with **entertainment** and **relaxation** areas
  * We invest in your education - company paid **training courses**
  * Extra** day off **for each year you work at the company
  * Company-sponsored **SportPass** cards for various sports activities
  * Private **health insurance**
  * Free **parking**
  * **Relocation** assistance
  * And more...

_If you think we are a good match, send us your **CV in English** now!_

title: Software Developer
description:
|  SolarEdge invented an intelligent inverter solution that revolutionized the
way power is harvested and managed in a solar photovoltaic (PV) system. The
SolarEdge direct current (DC) optimized inverter system maximizes power
generation at the individual PV module level while lowering the cost of energy
produced by the solar PV system. Since beginning commercial shipments in 2010,
SolarEdge has shipped approximately 3.4 Gigawatt (GW) of its DC optimized
inverter systems and products have been installed in solar PV systems in more
than 96 countries. SolarEdge’s mission is to become the leading provider of
inverter solutions across all solar PV market segments and broaden the
availability of clean, renewable solar energy.  
  
**Job Description:**  
In this role you will be a full stack developer of a complex product. For
development you will use a state of the art technology stack including Java 8,
Spring, Hibernate, Tomcat, MySQL, TypeScript, React and WebGL. Your work will
include design, implementation and unit testing. We offer a pleasant working
environment, great technological challenges and a great team spirit. We are
looking for talented developers that are seeking for challenging tasks and
eager to learn and master new technologies.  
  
**Requirements:**  
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from a leading university  
• At least 2 years of software development  
• Experience in the development (design & programming) of scalable Web
applications – Java.  
• Familiarity with our technology stack (Spring, Hibernate, React…) –
Advantage.  
• Fluent English  
  
**Personal skills:**  
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills  
• Patient and dedicated ability to execute tasks from initiation to completion  
• Taking an analytic approach to problem solving, creative thinking  
• Quick learning capabilities  
• Highly motivated  
• Independent  
  
**Important: Please, send applications in English only.**

title: IT Analyst – Financial Software
description:
|

**As an IT Analyst**, located in Sofia, you will be responsible for providing technical support for BISAM’s B-One product - a market-leading performance and attribution software solution.

B-One is trusted by 10 of the top 50 global asset managers whose combined
Assets under Management exceed 10 trillion USD with global operations across
North America, EMEA and APAC.

These global asset managers rely on B-One on a daily basis for:

  * the official results that are provided to their clients/funds
  * the performance analytics explaining their investment processes that are used by portfolio managers, relationship managers, sales & marketing and client reporting teams.

You will work as the first point of contact for all customer queries regarding
the product functionality as well as any issues raised by Professional
Services team during B-One implementations and other customer projects. This
role is integral to building strong customer relations and the individual
needs to be a strong communicator and customer focused to succeed in the role.

The customer experience team works closely with a number of internal teams to
resolve customer queries. The individual will need to manage and maintain
communications across all of these teams including Product Support, Architects
and Research & Development in tracking bugs, to ensure timely responses
and resolutions as well as the Account Management team in case a customer
raises an Enhancement request or requires Professional Services’ assistance.

** **

**Responsibilities:**

Reporting to the Head of Customer Support, you will assist the support team on
the following tasks:

  * Contribute to the on-going support of clients by analyzing and solving complex technical, application or database issues
  * Responsible for the management of support tickets ensuring timely responses are sent in accordance to the Service Level Agreements
  * Investigate and troubleshoot tickets raised by customers qualifying any potential software defects
  * Support the defect resolution process by providing clear descriptions of defects and validating the resulting fixes
  * Identify errors and mistakes in BISAM’s software and documentation and suggest corrections and improvements
  * Logging and assisting in debugging identified defects, working with other teams within BISAM, ensuring all information required is captured and transferred
  * Active participation in enriching the Knowledge Base
  * Engage proactively with customers regarding their tickets, providing regular and clear updates
  * Maintain a professional and courteous manner with customers and colleagues alike
  * Build strong relationships with all areas of the BISAM business so as to ensure delivery of a world class service to the customers
  * Managing customer expectations and relationships to the highest level
  * Support your colleagues as required in the resolution of customer enquiries
  * Continually seek to develop your knowledge of the B-One solution, both technical and functional

** **

**Desired Qualifications, Skills & Experience:**

  * Strong Bachelor or Master Degree in Computer Science, IT, Finance or Mathematics
  * Highly proficient in spoken and written English
  * SQL query tuning and troubleshooting
  * Oracle 11G/12C administration and troubleshooting
  * SQL Server knowledge
  * Java application servers, especially Tomcat
  * Java application tuning, instrumentation, troubleshooting
  * Linux and Windows system administration and shell scripting
  * Message queues: JMS, ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ
  * Web services (SOAP/WSDL)
  * Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills
  * Strong math skills
  * Highly pro-active approach
  * Analytical thinker
  * Strong team player
  * Service minded attitude
  * Very enthusiastic and motivated

  * Speaking French is a big plus as some of our clients are French
  * Knowledge of the asset management industry is a plus
  * Experience with performance measurement or attribution is a plus
  * Knowledge of financial reporting and BIRT specifically is a plus
  * Experience with customer support is a plus

**Location:**

  * Sofia (training is done in Paris and London)

If you enjoy a fast paced work environment with opportunities for growth,
development and success, then please send your resume and cover letter in
English to be considered for this position.

BISAM recruits talented individuals around the world and offers a wide variety
of benefits including:

  * Very competitive salary
  * Annual bonus opportunity
  * Internal and external training opportunities
  * Career development opportunities across our various teams and offices in Europe and North America (Paris, London, NY, Boston, LA).

title: Business Analyst – Financial Software
description:
|

**As a Business Analyst,** located in Sofia, you will be responsible for providing support for BISAM’s B-One product - a market-leading performance and attribution software solution.

B-One is trusted by 10 of the top 50 global asset managers whose combined
Assets under Management exceed 10 trillion USD with global operations across
North America, EMEA and APAC.

  
These global asset managers rely on B-One on a daily basis for:

  * the official results that are provided to their clients/funds

You will work as the first point of contact for all customer queries regarding

role is integral to building strong customer relations and the individual

The customer experience team works closely with a number of internal teams to

title: QA AUTOMATION SPECIALIST
description:
|

**DESCRIPTION  
**  
We are an international software company focused on mobile security, privacy
and end-to-end encryption. Our flagship products are the Android-based Secure
Phone and Secure Pack, as well as Secure BlackBerry.  
  
**Secure Group**, formerly DELATEK, is an international provider of solutions for secure mobile communications. As the name implies, we enable our customers to exchange sensitive information safely, protecting their business and personal life.  
  
We have built a name for our secure and user-friendly Secure Phone and Secure
BlackBerry smartphones, as well as Secure Pack – our suite of mobile
communication apps. Our products employ the best end-to-end encryption
technologies available.  
  
**OUR MISSION**  
  
Our ultimate mission is to ensure our customers’ cyber-security and enable
them to communicate in full privacy without compromising neither protection,
nor user-friendliness.  
  
**OUR VISION**  
  
No great goal could ever be achieved without a great vision. To accomplish our
mission, we have committed to providing the best encrypted communication
products, services and solutions, and to educating people.  
  
**We're now hiring a QA Automation Specialist at our main R&D center, located in Sofia, Bulgaria.  
**  
**REQUIREMENTS**

  * Relevant education
  * 3+ years of experience in software testing
  * 1+ years if experience in testing automation
  * Experience in using a version control system
  * Knowledge in HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  * Working level of English

_**It would be a plus** to have tome knowledge and experience with:_

  * Agile methodologies
  * CasperJS, NodeJS, MySQL, Apache, web analytics tools
  * Selenium, Jira, GIT, SoapUI

**BENEFITS  
**

  * Competitive** remuneration**
  * Excellent working** environment**
  * Spacious office with** entertainment** and** relaxation** areas
  * We'll invest in your education — company-paid** tech courses**
  * Extra** day off** for each year you work at the company
  * Company-sponsored **SportPass** cards for various sports activities
  * Private **health insurance**
  * Free** parking**
  * **Relocation** assistance
  * And more...

_If you think we might be a good match, send us your **CV in English** now!_

title: Senior Software Engineer, PS COE
description:
|  VMware is a global leader in cloud infrastructure and business mobility.
Built on VMware's industry-leading virtualization technology, our solutions
deliver a new model of IT that is fluid, instant and more secure. Customers
can innovate faster by rapidly developing, automatically delivering and more
safely consuming any application.  
  
With 2015 revenues of $6.6 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers,
more than 75,000 partners, and 19,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the
world. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution,
passion, integrity, customers, and community. Do you dare to do the stuff
you've always dreamed about?  
  
The major focus of the engineers in the Professional Services Center of
Excellence is working with VMware technologies that build the automation,
orchestration and management of virtual infrastructure and cloud. The team
delivers solutions that help customers to fully benefit from the capabilities
of a virtual infrastructure by integrating open source and third party
products and automating processes. To achieve this, the following VMware
products are mainly but not solely used:  
  
• vCenter Orchestrator  
• vCloud Automation Center  
• vCenter Operations Management Suite  
  
Our team is looking for talented professionals who share our passion for
technology, innovation and excellence to help us exceed customer expectations
and increase our market-leading position. We are targeting the enterprise
markets and our solutions must scale well with millions of objects so please
bear in mind that we need developers who understand or are willing to learn
the specifics of the enterprise level programming.  
  
Responsibilities:  
\- Be part of an integration and automation team that works in collaboration
with management, professional services, and R&D teams  
\- Analyze customer requirements to produce technical solutions based on
VMware technologies  
\- Conduct engagements with customers in a timely and effective manner  
\- Define estimates and plans for software delivery in conjunction with the
Project Manager  
\- Amend and refine custom solutions on-site in an agile manner  
\- Write high-quality code and script solutions in PowerShell, JavaScript, C#,
Perl, Python, Java, and others  
\- Perform code reviews to other team members and receive code reviews of your
code  
\- Adhere to VMware internal processes during the whole development cycle –
idea, patent, requirements, specifications, designs, implementation, bug
fixing, QA, support, and so on  
\- Build and maintain confidence of colleagues and customers  
\- Maintain current knowledge of the entire VMware product line  
\- Help document best practices in developing and deploying VMware solutions,
and feed them into our knowledge base for reuse by the team, customers and
partners.  
  
Requirements:  
\- Minimum 2 years of professional programming experience with one of the
following OOP languages: Java, C++, or C#.  
\- Scripting skills in any of the following: JavaScript, Python, Perl,
PowerShell, Bash  
\- Excellent analytical and problem solving skills  
\- Ability to work without close supervision and with proactive, goal-oriented
attitude  
\- Willingness to use different programming languages to address specific
project needs  
\- Familiarity with systems management concepts, processes and standards;
capacity and performance management and tuning; storage and network management  
\- Excellent written and verbal communication skills  
\- Fluent in English language: speaking, reading, and writing  
\- The applicant must be available to work full-time in Sofia  
\- BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent technical experience.  
  
Any of the following competences and skills will be considered a strong plus:  
\- Fluency in German, French, Spanish, Italian or another European language  
\- Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.  
  
VMware offers:  
\- Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus
scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long-term
incentives.  
\- Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced
by learning and development program, regular performance assessment,
opportunity to work with international teams of IT professionals.  
\- Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical insurance program,
food and beverage program, sport activities, open communication.  
\- Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, regular team buildings and
celebrations.  
  
All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.  
  
As part of the VMware global standards for integrity you will be required to
go through a pre-employment screening process before you join.

title: JavaScript/AngularJS Developer
description:
|  We are looking for experienced JavaScript developer with excellent
knowledge in AngularJS to join our web development team.  
  
Heads up:  
  
We are as interested in your work experience as we are in the kind of person
you are. At Melon we believe there are three key qualities to being a good
teammate, as well as client: being smart, delivering results and being nice.
This is why beyond your skills, we value character, reason and sense of humor,
and we appreciate potential for growth.  
  
Our team is supportive, hard-working and friendly and we like to keep it this
way. If you would like to join Melon, here’s what you will do most of the
time:  
  
∙ Work on custom projects for clients, sometimes very closely with their team  
∙ Keep a healthy communication with your project manager and client  
∙ Take active part in all project stages – analysis, estimation,
documentation, coding, bug fixing and support  
∙ Develop our own products  
∙ Learn from your colleagues and teach them what you know  
  
Requirements:  
  
∙ 2+ years of experience using JavaScript and AngularJS  
∙ Excellent knowledge and skills in OOP  
∙ Excellent knowledge in jQuery  
∙ Good knowledge in HTML and CSS  
∙ Teamwork experience  
∙ Good communication skills (everything from showing empathy to being able to
present your ideas clearly and resolve conflicts in a non-violent way)  
∙ Good command of English (reading, writing, speaking)  
∙ Internal drive to learn, improve and succeed (coffee’s on us)  
  
Advantages:  
  
∙ Knowledge in HTML5 and CSS3  
∙ Knowledge in Node.js, Durandal JS, Backbone.js, Knockout  
∙ Knowledge in JSON  
∙ Knowledge in Jasmine  
  
Education:  
  
Computer Science or related field and/or demonstrated capability through
previous experience.  
  
What we offer:  
  
This is a full-time position that comes with a competitive salary and an
opportunity to grow within the company based on demonstrated merit.  
  
The key thing about Melon? You get an opportunity to tackle challenging work
tasks in a dynamic, but supportive organization. Our company culture is
people-oriented and informal. This mix attracts good teammates and interesting
clients.  
  
To apply, please send your CV with the position reference in the subject. If
you have written relevant code, we encourage you to send an example.  
  
Your application will be treated with confidentiality.  
  
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.

title: Technical Account Manager
company: Hewlett Packard Enterprise / Hewlett-Packard GDBC EOOD
description:
|  Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) creates new possibilities for technology
to have a meaningful impact on people, businesses, governments and society.
HPE invents, engineers, and delivers technology solutions that drive business
value, create social value, and improve the lives of our clients. The largest
line of business - Enterprise Services produces better business outcomes for
our clients through our comprehensive Infrastructure Technology Outsourcing
Services. Our service excellence, with consistent globally delivered
standardized services guarantees clients peace of mind, while our ability to
drive innovation ensures clients a compelling strategy for the future.  
  
  
The primary role of the Technical Account Manager (TAM) is to deliver
proactive services and to provide technical advocacy to TS Support Services
Customers across the MEMA region. The TAM will also deliver Hardware Break-Fix
services to mission critical customers on a rotation basis. TAM’s must have a
strong technical aptitude for preventing problems. They are a valued technical
resource to customers, peers, and all members of the Hewlett Packard
Enterprise (HPE) Account Team.  
  
TAM’s are typically experts in HPE Technical Services (TS) Support Services
Portfolio. A TAM is a partner with their Proactive Service Customers and need
to have an in-depth understanding of the customer environments from both a
technical and operational level or may be un-assigned (aka pooled) to support
Proactive Care and Lifecycle Event Services (LES).  
  
TAM’s have very strong verbal and written communication skills. In event of
customer satisfaction issue, TAM will partner as needed with appropriate GSD
resources to ensure resolution. The TAM will work closely with the Account
Support Manager to create long lasting relationships with our customers and
create customers for life.  
  
  
Education and Experience Required:  
5-10 years’ experience in relevant technologies and customer environments.
Relevant industry qualification where applicable.  
Fluent English, French or Arabic would be a benefit.  
  
Technical skills  
Foundational level knowledge across all key technologies.  
Specialist level knowledge in Converged Infrastructure and Management Tools  
One or more of the following: BCS, ISS, Networking, Tape Library, Storage
diagnoses and resolution knowledge  
Customer’s advocate & technical focal point for the ongoing support of the
IT environment  
Monitor cases and analysis of customer systems  
Server Storage & Networking Experience a plus  
Experience with understanding:  
Hardware replacement  
Firmware upgrades  
Installing patches  
  
O.S. Knowledge:  
Windows, Linux or Unix  
Virtualization experience (VMware)  
Help Facilitate Meeting & Collaborate with other groups  
Knowledge of collecting/analyzing data logs & generating reports.  
Analytics, Trend analysis experience a plus  
Proficient with Microsoft Office products ( Excel, PowerPoint and Word)  
  
Customer Services Skills  
Superior verbal and written communication and listening skills  
Experienced proven problem solver  
Builds effective relationships  
Excellent planning and organization skills  
Strong time management and prioritization skills  
Presentation skills and ability to speak in front of groups (virtually /
onsite)  
Cross functional awareness  
Self-motivated and ability to work independently  
Ability to analyze trends and make customer solution oriented recommendations  
Ability to take decisions to enhance the customer’s support experience  
Ability to look at business opportunities  
Ability to work effectively in a virtual team setting  
Willingness to work on shift basis  
  
  
We offer:  
  
• Membership in highly qualified young, enthusiastic team;  
• Competitive remuneration package;  
• Medical insurance;  
• 4 days additional paid leave (total:24 days);  
• Food vouchers;  
• Life insurance;  
• Wellness program;  
• HPE badge program including various discounts for products and services;  
• Work-life balance program including free legal, financial and psychological
consultations.  
  
  
  
  
  
Thanks for taking the time to review our job, if you think it is a match to
your experience and interests please apply today— we are eager to learn more
about you! If you know a friend who may be a fit for the job please refer
them.  
  
  
  
This is to inform you that Hewlett Packard GDBC EOOD (HP) is registered as an
administrator of personal data to the Commission for Data Protection. Some of
the information that you provide voluntarily is personal information and falls
under the special protection regime under the Law on Personal Data Protection.
The personal data provided by you will be processed for the purposes of the
selection process as well as for the realization of the legitimate interests
of the data controller in respect of any future contract of employment. HP
takes the responsibility to handle, use and store your personal data, ensuring
its protection in secret from the third parties. We inform you and you agree
that HP may provide your personal data to government, municipal institutions,
banks, companies, corporate bodies and individuals, where such obligation
exists under a special legal provision, where it is necessary for realization
of your rights and legal interests as a participant in the selection process,
and when it is necessary to realize the legitimate rights and interests of HP.
HP can provide your personal information to corporate bodies and individuals
who are assigned to actions and activities relating to the selection process
and in respect of any future contract of employment.

title: 2nd Line IT support Technician
description:
|  RTW Hosting / Backbone is one of the UKs leading premium service providers,
whose customers range from small 5 user SMEs to larger organizations of 200+
users. The company provides both Hosted and On-Premise IT services to a
growing UK customer base.  
  
We have a blend of customers with around 80% hosted and the remainder running
their own traditional in-house physical servers. This opportunity is ideal for
someone that has a thirst for knowledge and a desire to advance their IT
skills and knowledge. Joining our Support team as an IT Support Engineer your
focus will be to meet SLAs and provide high level technical support.  
  
If you get pleasure out of delivering outstanding response times, exceptional
customer service and enjoy variety, this is the job for you!  
  
In your role as 2nd line Support Engineer you will:  
• Provide IT support for UK based clients  
• Manage user and computer accounts in a Microsoft Active Directory
environment  
• Participate in the workstation lifecycle management - configuration,
maintenance, coordinated replacement and end of life.  
• Work closely with the Networking team to resolve various network
connectivity issues  
• Participate in the team’s various ongoing projects  
• Enhance users experience by improving existing or introducing new systems
and processes  
• Spam filer and email archiving management  
• Setup VoIP accounts and configure SIP phones based on Swyx phone system.  
• Configuration and administration of network printers managed by Windows
Printer management.  
  
You will be the person who has:  
• Fluency in English  
• At least 1-2 years of experience in the IT end user support field  
• Strong Windows workstation troubleshooting skills (Windows 7, 8.1 or 10)  
• Administration experience in Active Directory, Exchange, Vmware, Hyper-v  
• Good understanding of networking basics like DHCP, DNS, IP sub-netting, Wi-
Fi technologies  
• Good hardware knowledge  
• Good communication skills and self-motivation  
• Microsoft, Cisco or similar industry certifications will be considered an
advantage  
• Experience with Mac OS X, IIS, DFS/NTFS or WSUS will be considered an
advantage  
  
If you are looking for:  
• Constant stream of IT challenges to solve, with the resources to solve them  
• Chance to work with cutting-edge technologies - Windows 10, OS X El Capitan,
Office 365, VMware horizon  
• Expanding your IT knowledge and acquiring Microsoft, CISCO and other
industry certifications  
• Informal, friendly and knowledge environment  
• Young, smart and motivated people to work with  
• Opportunity for professional growth

title: Clojure Developer
description:
|

**Who we are:**

**Tick42** delivers real-time software to some of the world’s largest investment banks and hedge funds. We are expanding our Development Centre in Sofia and are looking for clever, highly motivated **Clojure** developers.

**What you are going to be doing:**

You will get involved in developing new products and extending our existing
ones. You will deliver resilient, high performance, well tested code you're
proud of.  
****

· Core Clojure - REPL, namespaces, special forms, destructuring, core data
structures (sequence abstraction, lists, vectors, maps, sets, queues), FP
basics (filter, map, reduce, functional composition and higher-order
functions), transducers  
· Using and writing macros

· git

problem solvers  
· Good command of written and spoken English  
· Ability to work independently or in small teams  
· Ability to work in multi-site international teams

**_Desirable:_**

· Experience with clojure.spec (it's not that new now! :)  
· Prior/current Java experience  
· Experience with Component or Mount libraries  
· 4clojure or github account

**What we offer:**

· Salaries in line with the highest in Bulgaria  
· Significant bonuses every 6 months based on personal and company performance  
· Flexible working hours  
· 25 days paid annual holiday  
· New machines equipped with the best tools money can buy  
· Private health care  
· Free Gym membership  
· Rest area with foosball table, pool table and sofas  
· Free coffee and beverage  
· Flat company structure with leaders that listen

Send us your CV, ideally with a portfolio/github repo(s) and/or code samples
you’re proud of.  
  
Candidates of interest will be contacted within 2 weeks of application.
Interviews are usually held in person in our offices in Sofia.

title: Web Developer
SAP Hybris Developer
description:
|  Role Description  
  
As an IBM Software Developer, you'll use the latest tools and technologies
available to deliver state-of-the-art software. You'll be responsible for
ensuring that company software components are expertly designed, tested,
debugged, verified, and ready for integration into IBM's best-of-breed
solutions that help organizations improve their business outcomes in the
global market place.  
The application developer is responsible for developing and customizing Hybris
eCommerce functionalities for IBM client implementations. The role is also
responsible for performing unit testing and documenting the application code
and will communicate closely with the Business Analysis/Testing team. The
application developer will also provide technical support services during the
initial phase after the system is migrated to the production environment.  
  
  
Key Responsibilities:  
  
\- Implement and integrate e-Commerce solutions & services based on the
SAP Hybris platform  
\- Provide input for solution scope, design and estimations  
\- Provide subject matter expertise on Hybris e-Commerce.  
  
Required Skills and experience  
  
\- At least 3 years of experience in Java, Spring DI, Spring MVC, Spring
Integration  
\- At least 3 years of experience in Java 2 Platform Enterprise Edition (J2EE)
and Multi-Tier Internet Architecture  
\- XML  
\- Good understanding of the software development and testing process  
\- Excellent communication skills  
\- Fluency in English  
\- Fluency in Bulgarian  
  
For Back-End Developer:  
\- Experience with Design Patterns: MVC, Factory, Facade, Services, Strategy,
DAO, Inversion of Control, Encapsulation, Converter, Data Transport Objects,
Listener, etc.  
\- SQL experience  
\- Experience with Web Services (REST & SOAP), XML, XSLT, XPath, XQuery  
  
For Front-End Developer  
\- Experience with HTML, JSP, JSTL, JavaScript, JQuery, Servlets, REST-
services  
\- Experience with Spring-MVC, Spring-DI, Spring-Security  
\- Experience with Web Servers (most commonly in Apache-Tom Cat, and Apache-
HTTP-Server)  
\- Experience with design patterns: MVC, Facade, Inversion of Control,
Converter, Data Transport Objects, Listener  
  
Preferred Skills  
  
\- Experience as a developer in e-Commerce/Omni-channel projects  
\- Experience with Hybris e-Commerce or other e-Commerce platform  
\- Experience in integration with external ERP systems like SAP  
\- Knowledge of SAP-IDOC  
\- ANT, (Maven is a plus)  
  
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal
opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or
expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or
veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment
practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: System Monitoring and Event Routing Subject matter expert
company: Hewlett Packard Enterprise / Hewlett-Packard GDBC EOOD
description:
|  Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) creates new possibilities for technology
to have a meaningful impact on people, businesses, governments and society.
HPE invents, engineers, and delivers technology solutions that drive business
value, create social value, and improve the lives of our clients.  
  
  
You will be part of the Global Design, a WW organization with representatives
in all regions. Your focus will be EMEA customers. Within Global Design, you
will join the Monitoring and Automation Engineering team, who is responsible
to develop new infrastructure/application monitoring solution using HPOM or
BSM suites of products, to develop and implement event interfaces (adapters)
and process automation, to deploy those solutions for existing and new
customers during the transformation phase and to pass over to Operation team
for on-going operation activities.  
  
  
Responsibilities:  
• Implements part or all of the technical solution to the client, in
accordance with an agreed technical design. Occasionally responsible for
providing a detailed technical design for enterprise solutions. Understands a
broad spectrum of HP technology in order to provide part or all of a detailed
technical design which meets customer requirements.  
• Often leads small to medium technical projects. Works with and under the
direction of the Project/Technical Manager and with customer nominated
representatives. Liaises with Solutions Architect as appropriate.  
• Provides technical support and input on the application of technology to a
defined business segment. Provides advice on solution and integration
opportunities to defined segments.  
• Contributes to knowledge tools and communities, and ensures project
learning’s are documented and shared. Role models focuses on single customer.
Solves diverse and complex. May lead a project team.  
• Providing presales activities: delivery model costing, design consulting,
requirements gathering, solution presentation, etc.  
• Capable to communicate directly with customer  
  
Qualifications  
  
Education and Experience Required:  
•Typically 5-7 years of professional experience and a Bachelor of Arts/Science
or equivalent degree in computer science or related area of study;  
  
Essential Knowledge and Skills Required:  
• System monitoring experience and deploying solutions;  
• Analytical and problem solving skills per customer specific requirements and
security  
• Experience working with HP Operations Manager 9.x  
• Experience with development and implementation of event interfaces
(adapters) and process automation for HP Operations Manager 9.x  
• Experience with Run Book Automation implementation, testing and deployment  
• Proficiency with database development (SQL) and management  
• Proficiency at programming in the Perl, Shell, VBS, Python, Java or PHP
programming languages  
• Proficiency utilizing JSON, XML frameworks  
• Experience with Operating Systems UNIX (Linux, Solaris, HPUX, AIX) and
Windows  
• Experience designing and developing software applications  
• Experience in Software Testing, and Problem Solving  
• Experience documenting software functionality, ability to integrate software
with existing systems  
• Effective presentation, written communication, and verbal communication
skills in English  
  
  
We offer a challenging role including:  
• Continuous learning and technical training opportunities  
• Great opportunity for professional development in the IT field  
• Part in a team that has established itself as a preferred partner for Hi-
tech Services & Support throughout EMEA  
• Competitive remuneration package  
• Medical insurance  
• 4 days additional paid leave (total:24 days)  
• Food vouchers  
• Opportunity to use free bus / parking  
• Life insurance  
• Wellness program  
• HPE badge program including various discounts for products and services  
• Work-life balance program including free legal, financial and psychological
consultations  
  
  
This is to inform you that Hewlett Packard Enterprise GDBC EOOD (HPE) is
registered as an administrator of personal data to the Commission for Data
Protection. Some of the information that you provide voluntarily is personal
information and falls under the special protection regime under the Law on
Personal Data Protection. The personal data provided by you will be processed
for the purposes of the selection process as well as for the realization of
the legitimate interests of the data controller in respect of any future
contract of employment. HPE takes the responsibility to handle, use and store
your personal data, ensuring its protection in secret from the third parties.
We inform you and you agree that HPE may provide your personal data to
government, municipal institutions, banks, companies, corporate bodies and
individuals, where such obligation exists under a special legal provision,
where it is necessary for realization of your rights and legal interests as a
participant in the selection process, and when it is necessary to realize the

information to corporate bodies and individuals who are assigned to actions
and activities relating to the selection process and in respect of any future

title: Системен администратор
Network Security Engineer
description:
|  Playtech is a leading software provider for online gaming operators and can
be positively considered as one of the pioneers of the worldwide online and
land-based gaming industry. Company's business portfolio consists of the most
prominent names in the business, including Bet365, William Hill, Paddypower,
Gala, Coral, Betclic, Winner, Betfair, Poker770, etc. Behind the eminent
success of Playtech's products and services there are around 5,000 people
located in 13 countries, the majority of whom are engaged in research and
development of current and future gaming technologies.  
  
If you are creative, “out of box thinker”, youthful in your mind and ambitious
enough to make a difference in such a large scale international business, you
are more than welcome to apply for one of our open positions.  
  
  
**Job Description:**

  * __Monitor organization networks for security breaches and investigate a violation when one occurs
  * __Install and use software, such as firewalls and data encryption programs, to protect sensitive information
  * __Prepare reports that document security breaches and the extent of the damage caused by the breaches
  * __Conduct penetration testing, which is when analysts simulate attacks to look for vulnerabilities in their systems before they can be exploited
  * __Research the latest information technology (IT) security trends
  * __Help plan and carry out an organization way of handling security
  * __Develop security standards and best practices for their organization
  * __Recommend security enhancements to management or senior IT staff
  * __Help computer users when they need to install or learn about new security products and procedures

**Responsibilities:**

  * __Information Security Systems administrator including Monitor and control
  * __Auditing IT & Enterprise systems (Sox, ISO27001)
  * __Supporting critical systems
  * __Content control
  * __Supporting IT on critical systems 
  * __Policy and documentation creation
  * __Day to day hands on duties 

**Requirements:**

  * __Candidate who has a strong understanding of IP Internetworking and the security exposures and the mitigating designs and processes associated with them.
  * __Furthermore, someone who understands traditional and next generation network security technologies to identify and combat internal and external threats while delivering a secure, scalable and consistent service.
  * __Minimum 5 years’ experience design, deployment, and operations experience. with Checkpoint including CCSE/CCSA certifications
  * __Strong fundamental networking knowledge (IP subletting, Routing/Switching)
  * __Checkpoint / Firewall and VPN
  * __McAfee EPO
  * __CCNA – Preferred.
  * __CISSP / CRISC preferred.

**Qualifications:**

  * __Firewalls, Checkpoint, Fortigate, Juniper
  * __MacAfee products (EPO, MVM, MWG)
  * __Wireless LAN – (Cisco, 3Com, HP, Avaya, Alcatel-Lucent)
  * __Network Security
  * __Network access control
  * __Switching and Routing – (Cisco, 3Com, HP, Avaya, Alcatel-Lucent)
  * __Application Load-Balancing
  * __Content inspection – Advantage
  * __Identity management – Advantage
  * __Acceleration solutions – Advantage
  * __F5 BigIP – Advantage

**We Offer:**

  * __Friendly environment in a team of highly skilled and motivated young people
  * __Personal and professional development and unlimited growth opportunities
  * __Work on interesting projects in a leading multinational company
  * __Excellent remuneration and benefits package (medical insurance, food vouchers, free snacks and beverages, bonuses, etc.)
  * __Flexible working time and fresh atmosphere
  * __Trainings and regular team-buildings

title: Linux Embedded Software Engineer
description:
|

Do you enjoy professional challenges?

Are you interested in developing products that impact millions?

Are you passionate about technology, particularly IOT and Cloud?  
  
  

**RISCO Group **is a leading provider of technological security solutions, a pioneer in IOT (Internet of Things) that expands the security system into a Smart Home platform. Our cutting edge solutions include management platforms, cloud solutions, and smartphone applications, all part of a company-owned product and development cycle.

**If you are looking for **a well-established company, with a fast-paced, agile environment, offering technological challenges and professional growth, then this is the perfect opportunity for you.

The Linux Embedded Software Engineer will develop and maintain the embedded
environment for our **cloud-based access control system**, AxesPlus. The
system will work, every time, from power-on to potentially years of uptimes.

**_Requirements:_**

  * At least 5 years experience in embedded Linux development
  * Solid C/C++ development experience

title: Software Support Representative (Linux)
description:
|  IBM Technical Support Services’ (TSS) mission is to become the largest and
most successful provider of technical support services in the world. The
Client Innovation Center in Sofia, Bulgaria is building a trans-disciplinary
team of network support specialists tasked with supporting our clients in any
country worldwide.  
The Network Support Specialist – Tier 4 is a Customer Support Engineer role
that is a member of a technical team who’s responsible for owning and
resolving support requests raised by customers.  
  
**_ Responsibilities:_  
**   

  * IBM Linux support works with IBM’s largest clients providing technical assistance, diagnosing Linux defects and advising clients on upgrades. In addition these individuals will have “premium” role, supporting IBM’s clients that have signed up for our highest levels of support. In this role the individual will have account management responsibilities for clients that are assigned to them.

  * IBM Linux support is responsible for three distributions, Red Hat, SUSE and Ubuntu and three platforms, x86, Power and System z. As a result the environment is very dynamic, exposing the team to a broad range of technologies and endless learning opportunities.

  * The IBM Linux Support team is a highly collaborative group and the team members are each given the opportunity to establish themselves as a subject matter expert in their areas of interest. The team is not your typical support organization, the team members are highly skilled, they thrive in an environment that brings new challenges daily, fostering a culture of learning and they are driven in their efforts to help IBM’s client succeed.

  * IBM uses a follow-the-sun model coupled with an on-call rotation to ensure we can successfully provide 24x7 coverage. All team members are required to take part in the rotation.

  

_**Required Technical and Professional Expertise:**_

  * English fluent (both written and verbal), with neutral accent and good language comprehension
  * Willingness to work on swing/ night shifts
  * University degree in relevant field (i.e. computer science, engineering, etc..)
  * Sound problem determination and troubleshooting skills
  * 2 years of experience as a Linux administrator.
  * Problem solver
  * Excellent communication and listening skills
  * Team player
  * Very good analytical skills 
  * Eagerness/willingness to learn
  * Ability to perform under pressure
  * Ability to multi-task

**_Preferred Technical and Professional Experience:_**

  * 3 years of experience as a Linux administrator.
  * RHCE certification.
  * Technical Support experience by phone and email / Remote Delivery experience.
  * Knowledge of IT technology & infrastructure.

  
Additional information:  
  
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal
opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or
expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or
veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment
practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Software Development Specialist
description:
|

**Software Development Specialist - Sofia, Bulgaria  
  
Who are we?**

If you’re a smartphone user then you are part of an ever more connected and
digital world. At Amdocs, we are leading the digital revolution into the
future. From virtualized telecommunications networks, Big Data and Internet of
Things to mobile financial services, billing and operational support systems,
we are continually evolving our business to help you become more connected. We
make sure that when you watch a video on YouTube, message friends on SnapChat
or send your images on Instagram, you get a great service anytime, anywhere,
and on any device. We are at the heart of the telecommunications industry
working with giants such as AT&T, Vodafone, Telstra and Telefonica,
helping them create an amazing new world for you where technology is being
used in amazing new ways every single day.

******Role Definition:**

The successful Software Development Specialist will be working on one or more
specific modules within a large software system scope and will assume
ownership and accountability of specific modules within an application. You
will serve as an expert on specific Applications, modules or technologies, and
will deal with complex assignments during the software development life cycle.
You will join Amdocs Optima, which is designing and developing a converged
Prepaid/Postpaid product. This development group is in charge of Amdocs OPTIMA
UI solution including Customer data management, Self-care management and
more.** **

**Key Responsibilities**

  * Designs, develops, modifies, debugs and/or maintains software code according to functional, non-functional and technical design specifications. Follows Amdocs software engineering standards, agile (SCRUM) software development methodology and release processes. Ensures code is maintainable, scalable and supportable.
    * Provides technical support and guidance during solution design for new requirements, problem resolution for critical / complex issues. Highlights risks and helps mitigate risks from technical aspects.
    * Participates and leads the technical solution aspects of new sales opportunities by working closely with other solution architects, sales leads, technical and functional experts across the units. Present the solution to the internal and external customers.
    * Analyzes Product requirement documents, works closely with the Product Manager and Product Owner (the business owners of the Product) and come up with the solution architecture and high level designs. Performs impact assessment and Proof of concepts to back the solution and early detection of possible issues
    * Collaborates and adds value through participation in design reviews, provides comments and suggestions, and works with cross-functional teams to achieve goals. Serves as the technical focal point with other teams across the business unit to resolve issues related to interfacing functionalities and conceptual solution formation.
    * Brings continuous improvements/efficiencies to the software or business processes by utilizing software engineering tools and various innovative techniques, and reusing existing solutions.

**3 reasons why you should apply for this role!**

  1. You will be working within an extremely diverse and multi-cultural environment, and a fast growing and dynamic organization
  2. You will be provided with a rare learning opportunity within an experienced team
  3. You will be presented with a unique opportunity to get exposure to the latest technology, learn, innovate and grow.

**Critical Experiences and skills:**

  * **A university graduate with a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent**
  * At least 5 years of experience of OOP and design patterns.
  * At least 3 years of experience in NodeJS.
  * At least 2 year of experience of developing with ReactJS.
  * At least 3 years of experience in Bootstrap, JS, jQuery.
  * At least 3 years of experience in HTML5, CSS3
  * Experience in ASP.NET - preferred, not mandatory
  * Experience working with Java will be considered as advance
  * Experience in various DBs (MySQL/MongoDB/Oracle).
  * Experience working with Linux will be considered as advance
  * Proven experience in writing system design documents in English.
  * Experience with source control tool.
  * Knowledge in cloud technologies and tools will be considered an advantage.
  * Experience working in SCRUM methodology will be an advantage.
  * Team player with great interpersonal skills that can also work independently.
  * Self-initiated and quick learner with a can do approach.
  * Eager to learn new technologies and new concepts.

description:

title: MS SQL Server Engineer

description:

title: Technical Escalations Orange Account Manager
company: Hewlett Packard Enterprise / Hewlett-Packard GDBC EOOD
description:
|  Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) creates new possibilities for technology
to have a meaningful impact on people, businesses, governments and society.
HPE invents, engineers, and delivers technology solutions that drive business
value, create social value, and improve the lives of our clients. The largest
line of business - Enterprise Services produces better business outcomes for
our clients through our comprehensive Infrastructure Technology Outsourcing
Services. Our service excellence, with consistent globally delivered
standardized services guarantees clients peace of mind, while our ability to
drive innovation ensures clients a compelling strategy for the future.

The Technical Escalation Orange Account Manager is the key to a successful
escalation solution. This individual brings together all the elements needed
to ensure the escalation or issue at hand is resolved in a manner which is
both efficient and concludes in an outcome which suits the business needs of
the customer and HPE. He/She is responsible for the overall management of a
technical escalation and owns the overall action plan, management level
communication and drives decision making processes both internally and
externally.

The Technical Escalation Orange Account Manager is a part of a highly valued
team that coordinates technical resources across multiple departments and
ensures customer success by communicating professionally and in a timely
manner during the process of leading Technical Escalations/Outages. In the
most critical situation for a customer the Escalation Manager, backed by all
TS Global Support Delivery Teams, will enable HPE to make the difference in
providing support to our customers.

The holder of this position will be part of the Technical Escalation/Outage
Management Team, reporting to the Senior Manager - Technical
Escalations/Outage Management.

**Other key deliverables include: **

  * Act as the focal point for Technical Escalations/Outages liaising between the customer and the internal stake holders.
  * Act as the customer advocate and liaison to drive customer satisfaction.
  * Create a plan of action for each issue by aligning technical resources including Escalation Specialist, Level 2 Teams, Field Technical support representatives and Engineering to drive timely resolution of Escalations/Outages.
  * Proactively engage with internal stake holders to help HPE meet SLAs, organizational goals and metrics.
  * Communicate and effectively manage the customer's expectations at all levels of their organization.
  * Create strong synergies within the internal teams, along with being an active participant in the GEM community.
  * Ensure highest levels of customer satisfaction by proactively delivering information about Outages at a frequency that matches the situation's urgency.

** **

**Professional qualification requirements: **

  * 5 years’ experience in project/escalation management or in similar roles/businesses;
  * Experience in working with technology business, preferably storage, servers, and networking;
  * 3 + years’ experience in handling high level escalations for huge organizations or similar demonstrated experience;
  * Bachelor's (undergraduate) degree or Master's (graduate)degree in technical/scientific discipline or equivalent on the job experience;
  * Knowledge management skills: creation and re-use of intellectual capital;
  * Excellent communication and leadership skills;
  * Excellent project management and organizational skills;
  * Team player: ability and willingness to motivate and support other engineers;
  * Should be flexible to work in the nights or any flexible hours as per the business requirement as the technical escalation manager needs to manage outages/escalations for a 24*7 functioning organization.

**Core**:

  * Good understanding of service management principles, excellent understanding of Incident Management and Problem Management (ITIL certification a plus);
  * Good understanding of project management (PM) techniques and tools (PMP certification a plus);
  * Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  * Sound negotiating and excellent presentation skills;
  * Fluent in English;
  * Ability to summarize Technical content for non-Technical executive audience.

**  
We offer:**

  * Great opportunity for professional development in the IT field and continuous learning opportunities;
  * Competitive remuneration package;
  * Medical insurance;
  * 4 days additional paid leave (total: 24 days);
  * Food vouchers;
  * Life insurance;
  * Wellness program;
  * HPЕ badge program including various discounts for products and services;
  * Work-life balance program including free legal, financial and psychological consultations.

title: Service Desk Administrator with English and Spanish
description:
|  Looking for a place to kick-start your professional technical career?  
  
You want to become a significant player in the IT software market and to
develop international experience and work with European markets?  
We are offering you an opportunity to be part of our unique technical support
team that is helping leading customers all over Europe to properly use their
state –of-art solutions. If you have the drive to success and you are
ambitious to be a winner we trust that you will find us the ultimate working
place for you.  
  
  
We are a global IT service provider with activities in Europe, America, Asia
and Africa. Our base office in Europe is located in Sofia, and is focused on
providing technical support services for leading companies across Europe and
Middle East.  
  
For our Sofia-based office, we are currently looking for:  
  
Service Desk Administrator with English and Spanish  
  
Role Description:  
  
The primary responsibility of the Service Desk Administrator is the technical
support to our customers. This is a phone based operation. She/he will perform
suitable information gathering, analytical troubleshooting and problem
research, collaborating with other engineers as necessary.  
  
Required:  
  
• Fluency in English  
• Fluency in Spanish  
• Excellence in MS Office  
• Analytical problem solving skills and trouble shooting experience  
• Demonstrated excellence at teamwork, collaboration and knowledge sharing  
  
As an advantage will be considered:  
  
• IT Industry experience  
• Customer Support and/or Account Management experience with demonstrated
customer service soft skills  
• Prior experience with support with foreign language  
• Experience in different OS (e.g.Linux, Windows server)  
  
  
If you are interested in this offer, please send your CV in English.  
Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

title: Software Product Manager
description:
|

**About EngView Systems:**  
EngView Systems, part of Sirma Group Holding JSC, specializes in the
development of CAD/CAM systems for the packaging industry and in software
solutions for the measurement business as well. The company distributes its
products worldwide through a large network of partners and resellers, as well
as through own offices in Montreal, Canada and Sao Paulo, Brazil. It is
recognized from the European Information Technology Prize for outstanding
contributions to the generation and conversion of innovative ideas and R&D
results into products with strong market potential.  
We believe that every individual has the right to feel comfortable at their
workplace and to enjoy what they do. We offer our employees creative,
professional, friendly and open-minded organizational culture, since we are
convinced that self-motivated, responsible and creative people bring success
to the company.

**Job summary:**

The technical product manager is responsible for defining market requirements
and packaging the features into product releases. This position involves close
interaction with development leads, product architects, and key customers. A
strong technical background is required.

**Responsibilities:**

  * Gather and analyze information to define product specifications and review design specifications.
  * Define product specifications and or strategy.
  * Specify product requirements in the form of functional requirements, user stories, wireframes, and their objectives. 
  * Review product documentation and ensure successful product releases based on corporate priorities.
  * Create and own the product vision and strategic direction.
  * Contribute to the long term product vision, help build the roadmap. 
  * Communicate product strategy and functionality.
  * Conduct market research by working with internal teams.
  * Manage a product life-cycle from planning to tactical activities to cross company go to market planning. 
  * Define and drive the solution across all departments including the development of company wide go to market plans. 
  * Participate in customer facing events and conferences as a product expert. 

**Requirements: **

  * BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  * 5+ years experience in software delivery, including a mixture of product owner, architect, and software developer experience.
  * An influential decision-maker and strategist.
  * A problem solver who thrives in a fast-paced environment.
  * Demonstrable knowledge of computer science foundations.
  * Driven by collaboration and open communication.
  * A communicator and a listener.
  * Highly developed English written, oral, and graphic communications skills. 

******What's In It for You:**

  * The opportunity to help great ideas turn into great products. You will have the chance to work with cutting-edge technology experts on product concepts and their innovative applications globally.
  * Opportunity to become part and to influence in a company where initiative and good ideas are valued and rewarded.
  * Dynamic, interesting and diverse work on global projects.
  * Good development opportunities.
  * Fun and friendly working environment where team spirit is essential for the company culture.
  * Competitive salary

If you feel interested and challenged by this position and if you meet or even
excel the given criteria, we will be glad to hear from you and to further
discuss your professional aspirations.  
All applications will be dealt strictly confidentially. Only short-listed
candidates will be contacted.

title: Identity and Access Management Specialst

title: Cyber Security Analyst
company: Hewlett Packard Enterprise / Hewlett-Packard GDBC EOOD
description:
|  The Cyber Security Analysts are responsible for delivering operational
services to outsourcing accounts on time, on target with quality. He/she works
on shifts which include night shifts. The Cyber Security Analyst focuses on
accepting and analyzing security incidents related to the supported customer
environments. The main goal is to acknowledge, classify, collate and qualify
all incoming alerts from the customer's production environment and to achieve
a high level of customer satisfaction and predefined Service Level Agreements.
He/she works in close relationship with other teams and is under direct
supervision by the team management  
  
**Job specifics/responsibilities:**  
  
Incident Logging, Categorization, Prioritization, Management and Closing:  
  
• Open an Incident record (where not already automated) for each Incident to
record and track all relevant information  
• Provide a complete history of events and activities throughout the incident
lifecycle  
• Categorize and prioritize the Incident so that it can be handled quickly and
efficiently.  
• Prioritize the incident based on the Incident’s urgency and impact to the
business.  
• Ensure all alerts are acted upon conscientiously and in the framework
expected.  
  
Initial Diagnosis:  
  
• Identify all symptoms of the reported alert in order to establish the effect
on End Users / customer business operations.  
• Employment of diagnostic scripts, tools, known error databases and knowledge
base to assist with initial diagnosis.  
• Engage the relevant higher level support team.  
• If the alert is believed to be a Major Incident the Critical Incident
Manager / Shift Manager / Security Incident Response Manager needs to be
notified  
• Ongoing support activities to be performed according to SLAs and defined
timelines  
• Provide highest quality and according to predefined timelines  
• Strictly follow HP ITSM/ITIL processes and procedures  
  
  
**Education (degree) and professional experience required:**  
  
• Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical
Engineering, Management Information Systems or equivalent certifications
(MCSE, MCP, Oracle/MCDBA, HP-UX, CCNA, CCNP, SNIA).  
• Minimum of 1 year experience within IT Operations, infrastructure services
support (Systems NT, UX, Backups, DB’s, IT Security or Network management),
operations monitoring and end user support.  
• Minimum of 1 year hands-on technical knowledge of the applicable technology
platform that you will be responsible for: Network management, Security and HP
Open View Products. Must be able to demonstrate troubleshooting and problem
solving skills.  
  
**We offer a challenging role with the following benefits:**  
  
• Continuous learning and training opportunities.  
• Competitive remuneration package.  
• Medical insurance.  
• 4 days additional paid leave (total:24 days).  
• Food vouchers.

• Life insurance  
• Wellness program including company funded sport events and seminars.  
• HPE badge program including various discounts for products and services.  
• Work-life balance program including free legal, financial and psychological
consultations

title: Account Security Officer
company: Hewlett Packard Enterprise / Hewlett-Packard GDBC EOOD
description:
|  Hewlett Packard Enterprise is a global leader in managing, operating, and
provisioning IT infrastructure for a broad spectrum of customers.  
  
  
The Account Security Officer (ASO) is accountable for security governance,
compliance and quality of operational delivery for the customers assigned. The
ASO acts as a trusted advisor for both the client and HPE account, working
with senior management with specific focus to ensure that information assets
and technologies are adequately protected, in relation to client business
objectives and HPE’s contractual obligations to the client. This person will
work closely with the Head of Information Security from client side.  
  
This position is open to candidates with several years of experience in the IT
Security/ Audit areas.  
  
  
Responsibilities:  
  
• Ensure that HPE delivers security services to the client as it is agreed in
the contract  
• Develop strong collaborative relationships with the client Security team and
HPE account team  
• Lead HPE Security team, delegating tasks and reporting status of the
security levels on customer environment to Account management;  
• Participate in Client and HPE Information Security audits, liaise between
Client and HPE teams to ensure compliance, plan and track progress in case of
remediation needed  
• Recommend security improvements, upgrades, and/or purchases  
  
  
Requirements:  
  
• Relevant university degree (Computer science, Information Security or
similar);  
• Experience within the Information Technology field (Anti-virus, Windows or
network administration);  
• Knowledge in information security, ISO 27001, Risk Management;  
• Experience in the use of security principles; risk assessment policies and
standards; information security best practices, products and technologies; and
network technologies  
• Fluency in written and spoken English is a must;  
• English or North American cultural experience and communication skills;  
• Good business and soft skills;  
• A well organized and self-managed person;  
• A person able to work both as a team player and individually.  
  
Skills and knowledge that will be considered an advantage:  
  
• Good understanding of governance, risk and compliance;  
• Knowledge in information security best practices  
• An industry recognized certificate in the information security area will be
considered as advantage (e.g. CISSP, CISM, CISA )  
• Understanding of the ITIL Service Delivery Framework.  
• Fluency in another European Language is an advantage;  
  
What do we offer?  
• A dynamic working environment with passionate colleagues;  
• A job for a strong brand;  
• Possibilities for trainings and certification in the Security field  
• A competitive remuneration package;  
• Enormous potential to expand your knowledge in both breadth and depth;  
• In parallel, career advancement at your own initiative is further
facilitated within the broader HPE organization.  
• Continuous learning and development  
• Opportunity to attend specific technical and soft skill trainings
